content: Once you revoke the consent to use the {{organizationName}} {{productName}} auth data in the services, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} will automatically stop logging. Your accounts will not be deleted.

comment.text: This translation key is used for the description displayed when revoking consent to use {{organizationName}} {{productName}} auth data. It informs users that their accounts will not be deleted after revocation and explains what happens next. This appears in a dialog related to revoking OAuth permissions.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "تفويض" (tafweedh) translates to 'delegation' or 'authorization,' which isn't the most accurate for 'consent' in this context. A more appropriate term would be 'موافقة' (muwafaqah) which directly translates to consent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: بمجرد إلغاء الموافقة لاستخدام بيانات {{organizationName}} {{productName}} في الخدمات...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The variable names {{organizationName}} and {{productName}} are correctly placed but their consistency in both English and Arabic should be ensured throughout all translations to maintain clarity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Maintain consistent variable naming conventions across all translations.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "automatically stop logging" is translated as "avtomatik olaraq girişi dayandıracaq".  'Giriş' translates to 'access' or 'entry', which doesn't accurately convey the intended meaning of 'logging' (data recording).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Xidmətlərdə {{organizationName}} {{productName}} autentifikasiya məlumatından istifadə icazəsini ləğv etdikdə, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} avtomatik olaraq qeydləri dayandıracaq.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'ləğv' translates to 'revoke'. It should be considered whether a less formal word would be better suited for a user-facing message, depending on the target audience.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a less formal word for 'ləğv', like 'etmə' or 'saxlama', depending on the desired tone.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'profiles' (профили) is a less precise translation of 'accounts' (accounts). While not incorrect, 'accounts' would be more accurate in this context, as it refers to user accounts within the services.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: След като отмените съгласието за използване на данните за удостоверяване на {{organizationName}} {{productName}} в услугите, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} автоматично ще спре записването. Вашите акаунти няма да бъдат изтрити.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Czech translation of "logging" is not accurately conveyed by "přihlašovat". "Přihlašovat" implies logging in, whereas the English refers to data logging or recording. A more appropriate translation would be something along the lines of "záznamy" or "ukládání dat".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po odvolání souhlasu s použitím {{organizationName}} {{productName}} autorizačních údajů ve službách, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} automaticky přestane *ukládat data*.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: “Anmeldung stoppen” is an incorrect translation of "logging". "Anmeldung" means login/registration. A more accurate translation would be something like "Datenprotokollierung" (data logging) or "Protokollierung" (logging).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Sobald Sie die Zustimmung zur Nutzung der Auth-Daten von {{organizationName}} {{productName}} in den Diensten widerrufen, wird {{organizationName}} {{productName}} automatisch die Datenprotokollierung stoppen. Alternatively: Sobald Sie die Zustimmung zur Nutzung der Auth-Daten von {{organizationName}} {{productName}} in den Diensten widerrufen, wird {{organizationName}} {{productName}} automatisch die Protokollierung stoppen.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'auth data' is not accurately translated. 'Auth data' refers to authorization data, which grants access. A more appropriate translation would be 'δεδομένα εξουσιοδότησης' (data of authorization).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Μόλις ανακαλέσετε τη συγκατάθεση για τη χρήση των δεδομένων εξουσιοδότησης του {{productName}} της {{organizationName}} στις υπηρεσίες...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repetition of '{{productName}} της {{organizationName}}' is clunky. While technically correct because it mirrors the English, it sounds unnatural in Greek. Consider rephrasing to improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Μόλις ανακαλέσετε τη συγκατάθεση για τη χρήση των δεδομένων εξουσιοδότησης του {{productName}} από την {{organizationName}} στις υπηρεσίες...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'will automatically stop logging' is an awkward translation of 'will automatically stop logging.' A more natural translation would be 'dejará de registrarse automáticamente' or 'dejará de guardar datos automáticamente'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: dejará de registrarse automáticamente

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Your accounts will not be deleted' is a rather literal translation and could be improved for naturalness in Finnish. It sounds a little stiff.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Your accounts will not be deleted' could be rephrased as 'Tilisi eivät poistu' or 'Tilisi säilyvät'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence '{{organizationName}} {{productName}} lopettaa automaattisesti' is grammatically correct but could be slightly improved for flow. While technically correct, adding 'kirjaamisen' clarifies what is stopping.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{organizationName}} {{productName}} lopettaa automaattisesti kirjaamisen.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "stop logging" is translated as "cessera automatiquement de se connecter". While technically accurate, "cessera automatiquement de se connecter" implies a disconnection, whereas "stop logging" refers to stopping the recording of data. A more accurate translation would be "cessera automatiquement d'enregistrer".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: cessera automatiquement d'enregistrer

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence "Երբ չեղարկեք ծառայություններում..." is grammatically awkward. The verb conjugation is incorrect for the subject implied.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Երբ դուք չեղարկեք ծառայություններում...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The placement of the commas and punctuation could be improved for better readability. The repetition of {{organizationName}} {{productName}} feels clunky.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Երբ դուք չեղարկեք ծառայություններում {{organizationName}} {{productName}} վավերացման տվյալների օգտագործման համաձայնությունը, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} ավտոմատ կերպով կդադարեցնի գրանցումը։ Ձեր հաշիվները չեն ջնջվի։

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'registrare' is used for 'logging' which is not the best translation in this context. 'Registrare' can mean 'to register' or 'to record'.  A more appropriate translation for 'logging' would be 'tracciare' or 'monitorare'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Una volta revocato il consenso all'uso del {{organizationName}} {{productName}} nei servizi, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} smetterà automaticamente di tracciare. OR Una volta revocato il consenso all'uso del {{organizationName}} {{productName}} nei servizi, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} smetterà automaticamente di monitorare.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "로그인하는 것을 중단합니다" (log in) is inaccurate. The English text says that logging *stops*, not that the system stops letting users log in. The consent revocation should stop *logging* data.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 서비스에서 {{organizationName}} {{productName}} 인증 데이터 사용에 대한 동의를 철회하면 {{organizationName}} {{productName}}에서 자동으로 데이터 로깅을 중단합니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses "로그인하는 것을 중단합니다." which is a bit verbose and could be simplified. It's not a natural flow in Korean.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 서비스에서 {{organizationName}} {{productName}} 인증 데이터 사용에 대한 동의를 철회하면 {{organizationName}} {{productName}}에서 데이터 로깅을 자동으로 중단합니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ຮັບຜົນຮັບການອະນຸຍາດ" (rap phon rap anuyat) doesn't directly translate to "consent to use." A more accurate translation would be something like "ການຕົກລົງໃຫ້ອະນຸຍາດ” (kan tok ling hai anuyat) or simply “ການຕົກລົງ” (kan tok ling).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ເມື່ອທ່ານຍົກເລີກການຕົກລົງໃຫ້ອະນຸຍາດໃຊ້ຂໍ້ມູນ {{organizationName}} {{productName}} ຢູ່​ໃນ​ບໍ​ລິ​ການ​ຕ່າງໆ...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, the use of the Lao word for "use" (ໃຊ້) after "ຕົກລົງໃຫ້ອະນຸຍາດ" makes it sound slightly awkward. It’s more natural to integrate it into the overall consent phrasing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ເມື່ອທ່ານຍົກເລີກການຕົກລົງອະນຸຍາດການໃຊ້ຂໍ້ມູນ {{organizationName}} {{productName}} ຢູ່​ໃນ​ບໍ​ລິ​ການ​ຕ່າງໆ...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure is awkward and grammatically incorrect. The phrase "Zodra u de toestemming voor het gebruik van..." is overly verbose and cumbersome in Dutch.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Zodra u de toestemming intrekt voor het gebruik van de {{organizationName}} {{productName}} auth gegevens in de diensten, zal {{organizationName}} {{productName}} automatisch stoppen met loggen. Uw accounts worden niet verwijderd.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repetition of '{{organizationName}} {{productName}}' within the sentence makes it sound unnatural.  While technically correct to mirror the English, a more natural flow would benefit the Dutch version.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Zodra u de toestemming intrekt voor het gebruik van {{organizationName}} {{productName}} auth gegevens in de diensten, zal {{organizationName}} {{productName}} automatisch stoppen met loggen. Uw accounts worden niet verwijderd.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repetition of '{{productName}} {{organizationName}}' is awkward and doesn't match the English flow. The placement of organization and product is also reversed compared to the English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po wycofaniu zgody na użycie danych autoryzacji {{organizationName}} dla {{productName}} w usługach, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} automatycznie przestanie się logować.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation includes unnecessary repetition which leads to readability issues.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider restructuring to remove the repetition, maintaining clarity and natural flow. For example: 'Po wycofaniu zgody na użycie danych autoryzacji dla {{productName}} {{organizationName}} w usługach, {{organizationName}} przestanie automatycznie logować. Twoje konta nie zostaną usunięte.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'dados de autenticação' is redundant. 'Autenticação' already implies data.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Depois que você revogar o consentimento para usar os dados de autenticação da {{organizationName}} {{productName}} nos serviços, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} interromperá automaticamente o registro. Suas contas não serão excluídas.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'registro' is a somewhat literal translation of 'logging.' A more natural phrasing might be preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Depois que você revogar o consentimento para usar os dados de autenticação da {{organizationName}} {{productName}} nos serviços, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} interromperá automaticamente o acompanhamento. Suas contas não serão excluídas.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "auth data" is inaccurate. "Date de autentificare" directly translates to 'authentication data', which is a bit clunky. A more natural phrasing would be 'datele de autentificare'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Odată ce ați revocat consimțământul pentru utilizarea datelor de autentificare {{organizationName}} {{productName}} de către serviciu, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} va opri automat autentificarea. Conturile dvs nu vor fi șterse.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "de serviciul" is grammatically incorrect. It should be "de către serviciu" or simply rephrased to avoid the preposition altogether.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Odată ce ați revocat consimțământul pentru utilizarea datelor de autentificare {{organizationName}} {{productName}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} va opri automat autentificarea. Conturile dvs nu vor fi șterse.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "autentificare" is a direct translation of 'authentication'. While technically correct, it sounds overly formal and technical in this context. 'Logarea' (logging) might be more suitable depending on the intended audience.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Odată ce ați revocat consimțământul pentru utilizarea datelor de autentificare {{organizationName}} {{productName}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} va opri automat logarea. Conturile dvs nu vor fi șterse.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'revoke' is directly translated as 'revoke' which is not commonly used in Sinhala in this context. A more natural phrasing would be 'අ අවගණනය කිරීම' (ava ganaya karimata) or 'ඉවත් කිරීම' (iwat kirima) which means 'cancellation' or 'removal'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: සේවා වල {{organizationName}} {{productName}} බලපත්‍ර දත්ත භාවිත කිරීමට ඔබ කැමැත්ත අවගණනය කිරීම / ඉවත් කිරීම කළ පසු

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'ක්‍රීයව' (kriyawa) is misspelled. It should be 'ක්‍රියාත්මක' (kriyathmak)
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: සේවා වල {{organizationName}} {{productName}} බලපත්‍ර දත්ත භාවිත කිරීමට ඔබ කැමැත්ත අවගණනය කිරීම / ඉවත් කිරීම කළ පසු, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} විසින් ලොග් කිරීම ක්‍රියාත්මකව නතර කරනු ලැබේ.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation of "logging" is inaccurate. "Prihlasovať" means "to log in" or "to sign in", not "to log data." The intended meaning of 'logging' in the context of data collection is missing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po odvolaní súhlasu na používanie {{organizationName}} {{productName}} autorizačných údajov, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} sa automaticky prestane zaznamenávať dáta. (or a similar phrasing to indicate data logging)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation lacks a conjunction or more natural flow after 'automaticky prestane zaznamenávať dáta'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po odvolaní súhlasu na používanie {{organizationName}} {{productName}} autorizačných údajov, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} sa automaticky prestane zaznamenávať dáta, a vaše účty nebudú vymazané.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'auth data' is translated as 'podatkov v avtorizaciji'. While technically correct, it's a bit clunky. A more natural translation might be 'podatkov za avtorizacijo' or 'avtorizacijskih podatkov'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: podatkov za avtorizacijo

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Consistency in variable usage. The English uses double curly braces `{{organizationName}} {{productName}}`. The Slovenian translation should mirror this.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent use of double curly braces: {{organizationName}} {{productName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian word 'опозовете' (opozovete) for 'revoke' sounds somewhat formal and not natural in this context. A more common and user-friendly term would be 'укинете' (ukinete).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Када укинете пристанак за коришћење {{organizationName}} {{productName}} података за ауторизацију у услугама...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian word 'пријављује' (prijavljuje) which translates roughly to 'logs in' or 'registers' isn't quite right in the context of logging data. A better translation would reflect 'data logging' or 'collecting data'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Када укинете пристанак за коришћење {{organizationName}} {{productName}} података за ауторизацију у услугама, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} ће аутоматски престати да бележи податке.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "prijavljuje" (logs in/signs in) doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'logging' in a technical context. It implies a user action, whereas 'logging' refers to data recording.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Kada opozovete pristanak za korišćenje {{organizationName}} {{productName}} podataka za autorizaciju u uslugama, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} će automatski prestati da se beleži/evidentira.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation does not consistently apply the same formatting for placeholders like `{{organizationName}}` and `{{productName}}`.  In the English content, they are separated by a space, while in the Turkish translation, they are directly joined.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change "{{organizationName}}{{productName}}" to "{{organizationName}} {{productName}}" for consistency with the English source and maintain readability.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "припинить автоматичний вхід" (will stop automatic login) is an incorrect translation of "will automatically stop logging."  The original English implies stopping data logging, not login.  'Автоматичний вхід' refers to logging *in*, not logging *data*.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Після того як ви відкликаєте згоду на використання даних аутентифікації {{productName}} {{organizationName}} в службах, {{productName}} {{organizationName}} припинить автоматичне збирання даних.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term "登录" (dēnglù) in the translation doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'logging' in the context of data logging. It's closer to 'login' or 'logging in' as a user action. It should be translated to something that implies data collection and recording.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a term like "记录" (jìlù) which means 'record' or a phrase like "数据记录" (shùjù jìlù) meaning 'data recording'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation does not use the correct formatting for the placeholders {{organizationName}} and {{productName}}. While the placeholders are present, the context might require more explicit brackets or a specific rendering style.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent formatting for placeholders across all translated content. Consider adding a space before and after the placeholder, or using a different bracket style depending on the platform's requirements. Example: {{organizationName}} {{productName}}
